title: Shijiazhuang
summary: Shijiazhuang (/ˌʃiːdʒiəˈdʒwæŋ, ʃɜːr-/;[3] simplified Chinese: 石家庄; traditional Chinese: 石家莊; pinyin: Shíjiāzhuāng; Mandarin: [ʂɻ̩̌.tɕjá.ʈʂwáŋ]), formerly known as Shimen and romanized as Shihkiachwang, is the capital and largest city of North China's Hebei Province.[4] Administratively a prefecture-level city, it is about 266 kilometres (165 mi) southwest of Beijing,[5] and it administers eight districts, two county-level cities, and 12 counties.
